$NOK $MSFT   
 
Nokia (NYSE:NOK) will provide its data center switching solutions for Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) data center facilities to support the bandwidth growth to Microsoft Azure as part of a multi-faceted deal. 
 
With the significant growth of cloud services and cloud computing and the move to 400GE, Nokia has been selected to supply its 7250 IXR chassis-based interconnect routers to support high-density 400GE applications in Microsoft’s tier-2 network architecture. 
 
The company will also supply fixed-form-factor platforms to other Microsoft network applications. 
 
"Nokia brings density, performance and flexibility to Microsoft’s data center networks and cloud environments and is partnering with Microsoft to deliver chassis switches running the open source networking operating system SONiC," Microsoft Azure Networking executive David Maltz commented. 
 
https://seekingalpha.com/news/3824616-nokia-to-supply-data-center-switching-portfolio-for-microsofts-azure-platform

Rumor: $MSFT is developing a program that allows brands to advertise within free-to-play Xbox games which is expected to go live in 3Q22. The program intends to boost Xbox’s limited ad inventory by adding games capable of hosting ads, allowing more developers to sell ad space on the platform. Initially, Microsoft doesn’t plan to take a cut of Xbox’s ad revenue, so that game developers have more opportunity to profit. 
 
Last December Microsoft bought Xandr, from AT&T for about $1B. The acquisition’s goal was to combine Xandr’s large pool of data analytics with Microsoft’s global advertising customer base. 
 
As of July 2021, there was a total of 226.6M video game players in the US. 
 
FTC is investigating Microsoft's $68.7B buyout of Activision Blizzard.
